I'm sure you understand that there are a lot of bad people out there who would like to know the answer to that as well, so they could try and get around the warnings we need to give. So I'm sorry, but I can't answer that.

I can say that permanently banning someone is a rare step for us to take, and only happens when they have a continued history of ignoring moderator interventions, misbehavior, and other non-forum-friendly behaviors. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

As a suggestion: Would it be possible to change the default post sorting in support threads to 'by date' until a best answer is marked and than switch the sorting  back to 'by vote'? This would keep up the known structure within a thread and makes it easier to follow a discussion and different solutions. As soon as a post got marked as 'best answer', the sorting will return to 'by vote' and everyone who open the thread will see the solution right in the first position.

If it is not possible (or you just want me and others to switch the sorting manually every time), would it be possible to set a default sorting in the user profile settings? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

It is possible to change those subs to the normal chronological order, but we had a poll about the idea a while back and most of the forum members who voted disliked the idea. And unfortunately, that setting is not customizable; it's the same for everyone.

What exactly is a "warning point" and what do they do? 

> 
> 
> On 9/3/2018 at 5:45 AM, Deddly said:
> 
> 
> A post that could give bad people ideas, which was in response to a moderator explaining that he doesn't want to give bad people ideas, has been removed.
> 

Oops. ![:wacko:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_wacko.png ":wacko:")

Points are awarded on the severity of the offense, and they expire over time. If you have 5 active points, everything you submit goes through the new member queue for approval. If you have 10 active points, you can't post at all for a week and your posts need approval for 2 more weeks after that. If you accumulate 25, you're permabanned. 

We give 0-1 points for just about everything because that's almost always enough to remind people. You really have to put some effort into it to get more than that.
